message_1: What is the balanced chemical equation for the decomposition of sodium bicarbonate (baking soda) when heated?
message_2:
When sodium bicarbonate (NaHCO₃) is heated, it decomposes into sodium carbonate (Na₂CO₃), water (H₂O), and carbon dioxide (CO₂). The balanced chemical equation for this decomposition is:

2 NaHCO₃ (s) → Na₂CO₃ (s) + H₂O (g) + CO₂ (g)
